headline: Ovo Energy set to slash 1,700 jobs as crisis escalates
author: Giulia Bottaro
sentences: The news comes days after SSE Energy Services was ridiculed for suggesting households do a “few star jumps” and “have a cuddle with pets or loved one” to keep costs down.
Ovo Energy will slash 1,700 out of 6,200 roles, Sky News reported, as well as closing sites to focus on three locations in London, Bristol and Glasgow.

The Bristol-based supplier was established in 2009 and took over SSE's retail arm in 2020, increasing its customer base to 4.5m.
Stephen Fitzpatrick, Ovo’s founder and chief executive, apologised and blamed the gaffe on an employee having “a bad day”.
The new strategy involves a commitment to raise minimum pay to £12 an hour and moving all customer-facing jobs to the UK.
The Unite union said it warned in 2020 that Ovo was taking a risk when it took over the retail base of energy giant SSE.
Sharon Graham, general secretary of Unite, said the union would do everything in its power to defend members' jobs.
Domestic providers have been squeezed by the Government’s price cap while global wholesale power costs have soared.
About 26 have gone bust over the past five months including Bulb, the seventh-biggest supplier with 1.7m customers.
Ovo is expected to cut a quarter of its workforce as part of cost-saving measures to cope with the energy crisis.
Ovo had considered a takeover of Bulb before its collapse and is still expected to bid to take on its customers.
It is now the UK's third-largest gas and electricity supplier, behind Centrica's British Gas and E.ON Next.
